submit.done:
Thank you for your submission.

We have received your application.
Our review committee will begin processing your application and you will be notified in the next 5-10 business days of the status of your application.
Please note that you cannot begin construction on the roof until you have received approval from us. We are unable to fund projects that have already started or are complete.
submit.fail: Unable to submit! This report could not be submitted to the Administrator. Please try again.

uploadDetails:
1. Do not attach any files larger than 10 MB or your information may not be saved. To send files that are greater than 10 MB, please email Program Administrator .
  2. Please ensure that file names are no longer than 25 characters and contain no spaces or symbols.

GreenAgree.text: The proposed green roof will satisfy the requirements of Toronto’s Green Roof Construction Standard. Note: Applicants are required to obtain a permit from the Chief Building Official prior to construction. A copy of this permit is required upon verification of the Eco-Roof

Attachments.text: Roofing materials provided by manufacturer or supplier
Attachments.value: Roofing materials provided by manufacturer or supplier

MPHIPPA: MFIPPA Notice of Collection: The business contact information on this form and in relation to the Eco-Roof Incentive Program is used to administer the Eco-Roof Incentive Program, which will include, but not be limited to: processing of applications for the program; evaluation and verification of compliance with the Eco-Roof Incentive Program; evaluation of the Eco-Roof Incentive Program; use in governance, educational, promotional materials concerning the Eco-Roof Incentive Program; the issuing of payments in relation to the affected properties; updating the information concerning the affected properties, and collection of any unpaid amounts resulting under the Eco-Roof Incentive Program. Questions about this collection can be directed to the Eco-Roof Co-ordinator, Environment and Energy Division, 55 John Street, Metro Hall M5V 3C6. Telephone: 416- 392-1848. Email Program Administrator
tooltip_emissivity: Thermal emittance – Thermal emittance refers to a materials ability to release absorbed heat.
tooltip_initialsolar: Initial solar reflectance – Solar reflectance is a measure of the ability of a surface material to reflect sunlight on a scale of 0 to 1. Solar reflectance is also called "albedo." Please provide the initial or new solar reflectance value, as opposed to the aged or 3 year value.
tooltip_solarindex: Solar reflectance index (SRI) -  SRI is a value that incorporates both solar reflectance and thermal emittance in a singlevalue to represent a material's temperature in the sun. SRI can be used as an indicator of how hot a surface would getrelative to standard black and standard white surfaces. Materials with the highest SRI values are the coolest choices for roofing.
IntroText_ToBeDeleted:
Green roof updates

  • Incentive increased: The green roof incentive has increased to $100 / m2.
  • Structural Assessment Grants offered: Funding is now available to help determine whether an existing building can carry the additional load of a green roof.
  • Not-for-profit corporations: All new construction projects by not-for-profit corporations are eligible for green roof incentives.

Cool roof updates

  • Partial cool roof retrofits are now eligible. You can meet our 100% coverage requirement over time or all at once.
  • New buildings eligible: Cool roof projects on new buildings with a gross floor area of less than 2000 m2 are now eligible.

Please note:

  • You must submit your application before work on the roof starts.
  • Green roof projects greater than $100,000 and cool roof projects greater than $50,000 may be eligible for funding in excess of the funding maximum, subject to Council approval.
  • Incentives for eco-roof projects will be provided until funds are exhausted. We cannot guarantee funding for your eco-roof project will be available.
  • Please note that all measurements are required in SQUARE METERS. Please use a conversion calculatorOpens in a new window to convert square feet to square meters.
  • Refer to our Terms of Use Agreement Opens in a modal dialog for further information.
